content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Rome with a good rating (7 or above) that offers free cancellation and breakfast included, for a three-night stay from May 28 to May 31, 2026, for two adults.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first step is to enter the destination "Rome" in the "Where are you going?" input field to start the hotel search for Rome.
Action: Type [14]; Rome
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to select the check-in and check-out dates. The required dates are May 28 to May 31, 2026, but the current calendar is showing September and October 2025. I need to go forward in the calendar to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still need to advance the calendar to reach May 2026, as it currently displays October and November 2025. I should continue clicking "Next month."
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently displaying November and December 2025. I need to move several more months forward to reach May 2026 for the required check-in date.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.20
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays December 2025 and January 2026. I need to continue clicking "Next month" to reach May 2026 for the required check-in date.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays January and February 2026. I still need to continue clicking "Next month" to move forward to May 2026 for the appropriate check-in and check-out dates.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently on February and March 2026. To select the required check-in (May 28, 2026) and check-out (May 31, 2026) dates, I need to continue advancing the calendar further to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.28
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently showing March and April 2026. I need to keep moving forward to reach May 2026, as that is the required month for check-in and check-out.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays May 2026. I need to select May 28, 2026 as the check-in date and May 31, 2026 as the check-out date to match the required three-night stay.
Action: Click [87]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in date of May 28, 2026 is now selected. Next, I need to select the check-out date as May 31, 2026, which is located as [90] on the calendar.
Action: Click [90]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in and check-out dates (May 28–31, 2026) and traveler information (2 adults, 1 room) are set. To filter for hotels with good ratings (7+), free cancellation, and breakfast included, I should use the sidebar filters. The "Very Good: 8+" filter [31] is available, which more than satisfies the rating requirement (7+), so this can be applied.
Action: Click [31]
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Very Good: 8+" rating filter is applied. Next, I need to add additional filters for "free cancellation" and "breakfast included" to match the task requirements. I should scroll down the sidebar to find these filtering options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible filter section includes parking options and property types, but "free cancellation" and "breakfast included" are not visible yet. I need to scroll further down the page to find and apply these specific filters.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filters shown are for parking options and some property facilities. I have not yet located the "free cancellation" or "breakfast included" filters. I need to scroll down further to find and apply those options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current filters shown include property facilities, property rating, and review score, but still do not show "free cancellation" or "breakfast included." I need to continue scrolling down to reach the necessary filters for free cancellation and breakfast.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filters shown are for review scores, neighborhoods, and some room facilities. "Free cancellation" and "breakfast included" filters are still not visible, indicating they might be further down the filter sidebar.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.78
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sidebar filters currently visible are for room facilities, highly rated features, landmarks, and travel group, but still not for "free cancellation" or "breakfast included." These filters must be further down. I need to keep scrolling.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.8
